sentence: orsay, is a very pleasant throw back to traditional french food, and french service as well.
anyway, the food is good, the price is right and they have a decent wine list.
the second you walk through the heavy vault like door, with people anticipating your arrival you get the sense that you are going to have the dining ride of a lifetime.
pair you food with the excellent beers on tap or their well priced wine list.
a must for all the dosa lovers.
won't or can't is not in the service directory.
i was there on sat. for my birthday and we had an excellent time.

we live in new jersey and whenever we go into new york city we buy bagels to eat hot and then to freeze (they told me that if i call in the order, they'd bring it out to the car so i wouldn't have to look for parking).
i started out with a bombay beer which was big enough for two.
the menu consisted of standard brassiere food, better then places like balthazar etc.
highly recommended for a first date.
the food is great and the environment is even better.
watch the talented belly dancers as you enjoy delicious baba ganoush that's more lemony than smoky.
i would defiantly come back here again as one of my top choices.
nevertheless the food itself is pretty good.
the vibe is very relaxed and cozy, service was great and the food was excellent!
wondering who had the best deals we noticed a line had formed to wait for this one particular establishment.
just went here for my girlfriends 23rd bday.
just an odd group.
the food was ok and fair nothing to go crazy.
i like mamoun's food as well, but side by side, kati rolls just produce tastier food hands down.
i care more about the food and ambience.
forget the rush and the wait and the noise (which isn't actually that bad), i mean please, who goes to a steakhouse to be coddled and romantic?
to begin, we were told there was a 30 minute wait and started to leave, when the hostess offered to call us on our cell phone when the table was ready.
the atmosphere is noisy and the waiters are literally walking around doing things as fast as they can.
the place is a bit hidden away, but once you get there, it's all worth it.
i went to amma after a friend recommended it.
it is far more popular as a bar than as a restaurant, with only a few tables and the waiter being the bartender, but we greatly enjoyed the unobtrusive atmosphere.
the place does get crowded, so i recommend going between 4-5 pm.
seating is ok even though sometimes there's a lot of people.
i've enjoyed 99% of the dishes we've ordered with the only exceptions being the occasional too-authentic-for-me dish (i'm a daring eater but not that daring).
i went to del frisco's friday night with my boyfriend for an 8:00 reservation.
this place is not inviting and the food is totally weird.
i can't remember the last time i had such gross food in new york.
their calzones are horrific, bad, vomit-inducing, yuck.
after complaining about the chicken dish, the manager came over to tell us that, no one had ever complained before, and that we just didn't know what the dish was supposed to taste like.
dessert: pure disaster.

to top it all off.. the main reason we came to your restaurant was for the belly dancers and missed the first show as we were not seated yet and the 2nd belly dancer only danced at two tables in the back of the restaurant and never made it around to the other half of the restaurant.
if i wanted to deal with a crappy scene and annoying customers i'd go out in manhattan.
went there last night for 2 year anniversary, and wasn't all that impressed.
as for the bar, this is another bad idea.
when we stumbled on leon, we thought that we had found quite the gem but, we were certainly wrong.
worst place on smith street in brooklyn
never got an explanation as to what was going on.
if you like your music blasted and the system isn't that great and if you want to pay at least 100 dollar bottle minimum then you'll love it here.
the people in the restaurant were pretty obnoxious and loud.
i've waited over one hour for food.
please don't fool us.
